intro: Streptomanes, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, greenish or reddish flowers. Streptomanes species are typically found in temperate regions and are often associated with moist, shaded habitats. They have a fibrous root system and produce capsules as their fruit type. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
